Week 1.question: What is Anscombe’s Quartet and why is it important in visualization?
Who is Edward Tufte and why is he important in visualization?
Week 1.answer: Edward Tufte is a prominent figure in the field of information design and data visualization. He is regarded as one of the pioneers in establishing the principles and best practices for effectively presenting data in visiual formats. His work focuses on how we think about and create visual representatiosn of complex information. He is a primary advocate for minimalist design, focusing on data-ink ratio and chartjunk. He also talks about the lie factor, the importance of accuracy of visualzing data, a measure of how much a graphic disorts the data it is meant to represent. I know him best for his distaste in pie charts (they should never be used in his opinion)
